name: Chateau Canet

reviews.text: We spent a week+ at Chateau Canet in October. It was absolutely perfect. Our family of 12 celebrated my parents anniversary here (ages 7-76) and everyone found something to do. Victoria and Floris are wonderful hosts and went out of their way to arrange our numerous side trips with interesting locals (truffle walk, personal tour of Carcasonne, private chef, horse riding, dinners out). The property is gorgeous; we walked out to pick fresh figs every morning. That was just one of the highlights. The wine was good, the markets were nearby and delicious. There was plenty to do in the area surrounding Rustique - never a dull moment. It really was the perfect holiday. We felt spoiled by the attention and perfect accommodations.
reviews.title: Terrific Family Vacation

reviews.text: Just back from a few days of stay in C.Canet with wedding parties there and nearby. A wonderful place - warm welcome, lovely family - thoughtful, hard-working, yet so relaxed and willing to make anything possible (moon-harvesting participation included..) Everything was just perfect and we couldn't praise it highly enough. Thank you team Canet xxx
reviews.title: Great fun - super hosts

reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at Chateau Canet this summer. We went with our family of 4, and 4 other families. Highlights were biking along the Canal du Midi, hiking in the vineyards, fun in the pool, and a wonderful trip to the Castle in the old city. This is a wonderful place to let your kids run free, and to truly relax as a family. We hope to return next year for more wine tasting with Victoria and Floris our wonderful hosts.
reviews.title: Trip of a lifetime

reviews.text: We stayed at Chateau Canet this summer and it was an extraordinary experience. We went with 4 other families with children ranging from 4 to 16 and we each had our own gite that suited each family perfectly. Victoria and Floris (and their wonderful children) were incredible hosts and we enjoyed active hikes, bike rides through the canal and the best wine, food and hospitality we have ever known!
reviews.title: Magnificent!

reviews.text: iAs we approached our 75th birthdays we decided the nicest way to celebrate would be to gather our huge family together. As we number 40 or so, it wasn't going to be practical to do this at home, although we do live in a wonderful part of southern France. We found Chateau Canet on the internet and guessed immediately that it would be an ideal setting, 10 individual gites and excellent facilities in a beautiful setting, quite near to Carcassone. When we met Victoria we realised we had found our perfect facilitator. She was an essential ingredient with suggestions for activities, excursions, catering, arranging taxies and buses to meet parties arriving and leaving: nothing was too much trouble. Our week at Chateau Canet was a delightful experience, with Chardonnay , the largest gite, as the hub of a rewarding gathering. Our grandchildren played for hours in the pool, the grownups played tennis and boules, we barbecued and partied to our heart's content and by the end of the week felt that bonds had been wonderfully strengthened amongst our widely scattered young ones. Saying goodbye was sad, of course, but we'd had the happiest week of our lives.
reviews.title: unforgettable family holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in early July in one of the smaller gites. So pretty and well appointed.Entire Chateau is well kept and so attractive. The wines are superb and we took a number of bottles with us to continue on our vacation.The owners, Victoria and Floris, are wonderful hosts and make you feel so welcome as does the rest of their team.We look forward to returning to this wonderful region of France and especially to Chateau Canet
reviews.title: unforgettable

reviews.text: If you are looking for self-catering peace and quiet in a beautiful, historic, fascinating and abundant region, with warm and welcoming proprietors, in clean and comfortable cottage apartments, with ALL the facilities you could possibly require - then Canet is for you! We had a fabulous time and its all thanks to Vicky & Floris and their team who really care about their clients.. Thank you!
reviews.title: A piece of paradise..

reviews.text: I stayed stayed in the big house, Chardonnay, with my husband and 3 young children. We also had another family come to stay and the accommodation worked perfectly for 2 families. The house is private, beautifully equipped - it felt more like a friends house than paid accommodation. My older kids, 4 and 6, quickly found the playroom and reappeared in the house dressed as knights from the dress up box. They remained as knights for the week - unless they were in the pool. Location was perfect - a quick run into local village for fresh bread and local food stuffs, or to have a wine beside the canal du midi while the kids fed the ducks, 10 minutes further and we were at Carcassone - a real castle, perfect for my knights! But best of all were our hosts. Victoria and her staff, including her incredibly charming children. They were the perfect hosts, incredibly warm; even acting as babysitters for 5 little ones so we could enjoy a fascinating tour of the winery in peace. We enjoyed every aspect of our stay and will definitely return.
reviews.title: Couldnt have asked for more!

reviews.text: We(2 adults and kids 4 and 5) stayed there and we loved every minute of it... The house was excellent, and we got a warm welcome, a little info about the region and an invite to a wine tasting to meet the other guests. Our kids loved the playroom which had pretty much everything: play kitchen, little table and chairs, play lothes, books, games: they loved it! Although it was very simple, the playground was clean and new and the kids enjoyed it a lot. The region is a lot of fun, and there's a lot to do. Taking the boat on canal du midi or visite the caves and I think we went to Carcassonne three times and still our kids weren't bored by it...
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.text: Big plusses for Chateau Canet: lots of towels, nice cottages, clean pool, very very good advice on where to eat, a "reserve"-room which had picknickbackpacks, freezer, beachstuff and last but not least: the warm and friendly people running the place... Very good hotel, great holidayspot for young families!
reviews.title: What a warm welcome!

reviews.text: I'm just sitting enjoying a glass of Minervois I brought back from Chateau Canet and am reminded of what a wonderful experience we had there. My husband, sister and brother-in-law went to Chateau Canet last fall and we couldn't have been happier. The area is tranquille , gorgeous and full of history. It is ideal for long drives, scenic hikes, wine tasting and enjoying fresh local cuisine from the restaurants in the numerous small towns. The Chateau is beautiful and is ideally located close to many regional attractions including Carcassonne and the hilltop castles of the Cathars. Our hosts Floris and Victoria were so helpful and generous with their time. They provided us with valuable information about the area, helped plan day excursions and gave us a wonderful tour of their vineyard and winery...which was the highlight of our trip! The cottage that we had was just lovely...it was clean, comfortable and cosy and had every ammentity we could possibly need. Needless to say, I would highly recommend Chateau Canet...you won't be disappointed! And when you go make sure to get some wine to bring home so you can sit back and reminisce over the great time you had!
reviews.title: Great place with outstanding hosts!!

reviews.text: Oh yes and I do have to say...try their olive oil...hands down the best I've ever had!!!
reviews.title: Relaxing setting, good local attractions (and nice wine)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family stayed here in October during UK half-term. The setting of the Chateau is really beautiful and just outside a village (with easy access to supermarket for the self-catering apartments). We did a lot of touring around the countryside. I think to get the most out of a holiday here you would want a car. Very easy access to/from Carcasonne airport.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: Our top tips would be...
reviews.title: Great place for families

reviews.text: - guided tour around old city of Carcassone (the kids loved the stories)
reviews.title: good location, nice gîtes

reviews.text: We stayed here in June 2012 and thoroughly enjoyed our time. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The owners tend to keep to themselves.
reviews.title: Lovely place and good wine.

reviews.text: We had a two bedroom apartment with a wonderful balcony looking out the back of the property. We were right next to the storage tanks so there was a constant mechanical humming sound. However this did not bother us much. The kitchen (like most in France) was tiny but still had everything we needed. We did eat most meals in as we were travelling with two small children. We also made four jars of jam from the most amazing apricots from the orchard out the back. We took this home (along with a case of their best red and a bottle of olive oil).
reviews.title: Excellent family holiday in beautiful vineyard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On two evenings my husband and I went out and left our children with the babysitter. Great service.
reviews.title: More than we expected!

reviews.text: There is also a BBQ area which is a great place to cook (and not heat up your apartment) and meet some of the other guests. The pool area is also very nice. One day, one of the staff members brought out ice-cream for everyone. Once a week they offer a tour of the wine making facilities and also wine tasting. That was great.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay at Chateau Canet

reviews.text: There is also a small playroom with toys for the kids and a small playground.
reviews.title: Exceptional Visit

description: Château Canet is a traditional and family run wine estate, recognized as one of the leading "domaines" of Minervois, Languedoc-Roussillon. Among the vines and olive plantations you will find a cluster of nine independent cottages all converted from original buildings and the Château itself. Within the grounds you will find plenty to keep the whole family occupied including a swimming pool, tennis courts and children’s play room. While on holiday here you can explore the vineyards, hike through miles of private countryside following herb-scented trails or use one of the estate's bikes and venture further afield, along the peaceful country roads surrounding the estate.
